clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Prediction Model of Pathological Outcomes (Mesorectum Quality and Positive Circumferential Resection Margin) in Patients With Mid-low Rectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative Prediction Model of Pathological Outcomes (Mesorectum Quality and Positive Circumferential Resection Margin) in Patients With Mid-low Rectal Cancer
clinical_study.source: Institut d'Investigació Biomèdica de Girona Dr. Josep Trueta

brief_summary.textblock:
Elaboration of a preoperative prediction model of the quality of the mesorectum and the involvement of the circumferential margin in patients with mid-low rectal cancer who undergo laparoscopic anterior rectal resection.
In a second phase the investigators will study the utility of the prediction model in classifying patients with high risk of suboptimal quality of mesorectum and/or positive circumferential margin. Patients with high preoperative risk will undergo a transanal total mesorectal excision and patients with low risk a laparoscopic transabdominal mesorectal excision. The investigators finally will compare pathological outcomes ( quality of mesorectum and circumferential margin), survival and recurrence between the two groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the quality of mesorectum in the rectal specimen according to international consensus (goog quality, moderate quality and poor quality)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the quality of mesorectum as optimal or suboptimal (international consensus defines three grades of resection: Group 1: including mesorectal resection, good quality Group 2: intramesorectal resection: moderate quality Group 3: resection in the muscularis propria, poor quality). Investigators will group patients into two groups: optimal mesorectum (group 1) and suboptimal mesorectum (group 2-3).

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the circumferential margin status in the rectal specimen according international consensus (positive margin if tumor ≤ 1mm from circumferential margin)
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the circumferential margin status (positive or negative) in the rectal specimen according international consensus (positive margin if tumor ≤ 1mm from circumferential margin)

arm_group.description: Patients with high risk of suboptimal mesorectum quality and/or positive circumferential margin after the application of the preoperative prediction model developed
Patients with low risk of suboptimal mesorectum quality and/or positive circumferential margin after the application of the preoperative prediction model developed

intervention.intervention_name: Transanal total mesorectal excision of rectal cancer
intervention.description: To perform a total mesorectal excision through a transanal approach

study_pop.textblock: Patients affected of mid-low rectal cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients directed to laparoscopic anterior rectal resection through a transabdominal or a transanal approach.
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Histology of adenocarcinoma or adenoma
- With or without neoadjuvant chemoradiotherapy
- TNM classification: T2 or T3, any N stage or M stage
- Intention of resection R0
Exclusion Criteria:
- TNM classification: T1 or T4.
- Complicated rectal cancer or emergency surgery.
- Previous major colorectal surgery
